Info.Description: Converts the image into a high-contrast, black-and-white version by setting all pixels lighter than a certain level to white, and all pixels darker than that level to black. It's often used for graphic design purposes or to create stencil-like images.

Properties.Name: Level
Properties.Summary: Sets the cutoff point for the conversion to black and white. If a pixel's brightness is above this level, it will turn white; if it's below, it will turn black. Adjusting this level controls how much of the image becomes black or white.
